title: Out of Bounds Memory Read in exif_process_user_comment
content:
I have found and reported an out of bounds memory read in PHP [exif_process_user_comment]
When PHP EXIF extension is parsing EXIF information from an image, e.g. via exif_read_data() function, in PHP versions 7.1.x below 7.1.31, 7.2.x below 7.2.21 and 7.3.x below 7.3.8 it is possible to supply it with data what will cause it to read past the allocated buffer.
This has been fixed and assigned CVE-2019-11042
The bug report is here: https://bugs.php.net/bug.php?id=78256
https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-11042
https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-11042
Impact
This may lead to information disclosure or crash.
steps: Prepare an image file with specially crafted EXIF user comment data that triggers an out-of-bounds read
Use PHP's exif_read_data() function to parse the EXIF data from the prepared image file
vuln_description: An out-of-bounds memory read vulnerability exists in PHP's EXIF extension when processing user comments in EXIF data. When parsing EXIF information via exif_read_data(), specially crafted data can cause the function to read past the allocated buffer, potentially leading to information disclosure or application crash.
reason: The vulnerability involves a straightforward buffer read operation without proper bounds checking, which is a common type of memory safety issue. The attack requires no complex interactions between components or manipulation of application state. The vulnerability pattern (missing bounds check) is well-known in security research.
